docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 -- An appeal for American support of the Spanish Republicans' intended attempt to re-establish the Republic in Spain by peaceful methods was made at a news conference here today by Diego Martinez Barrio, former President of Spain.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 -- An appeal for American support of the Spanish Republicans' intended attempt to re-establish the Republic in Spain by peaceful methods was made at a news conference here today by Diego Martinez Barrio, former President of Spain.
docs.abstract: Liberation Com in Mex Pres Martinez Barrio appeals for US aid in re-establishing Repub, discusses proposed govt-in-exile

headline.main: AID TO REVIVE SPAIN AS REPUBLIC ASKED; Martinez Barrio, Ex-President, Seeks U.S. Support Prior to Convening of Cortes

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED DEC. 9, 1944

docs.snippet: A proposal that Germany and Japan be invited to participate in the next Olympic Games was howled down by more than 100 representatives attending an executive committee meeting of the U.S.A. Sports Federation at the New York Athletic Club last night.
docs.lead_paragraph: A proposal that Germany and Japan be invited to participate in the next Olympic Games was howled down by more than 100 representatives attending an executive committee meeting of the U.S.A. Sports Federation at the New York Athletic Club last night.
docs.abstract: US Amateur Sports Fed exec com meeting; post-war participation by Ger and Jap athletes opposed; Brundage asserts recent rept by him suggesting inv was misquoted; Brit Olympic Assn urges London games despite blitz

headline.main: German, Japanese Participation In Next Olympic Games Opposed; Strong Objections Are Made to Proposal at Meeting of Sports Federation Here -- Plea for London Choice Renewed

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 13 -- Navy forces today occupied refineries belonging to the state petroleum monopoly in La Plata, the capital of the Province of Buenos Aires, which were threatened by a strike called suddenly by the workers yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 13 -- Navy forces today occupied refineries belonging to the state petroleum monopoly in La Plata, the capital of the Province of Buenos Aires, which were threatened by a strike called suddenly by the workers yesterday.

docs.snippet: Expressing the view that inter-American relations were at their lowest ebb in a decade, the Foreign Policy Association said in a bulletin issued yesterday that nations south of the border may increasingly seek the friendship of the Soviet Union.
docs.lead_paragraph: Expressing the view that inter-American relations were at their lowest ebb in a decade, the Foreign Policy Association said in a bulletin issued yesterday that nations south of the border may increasingly seek the friendship of the Soviet Union.
docs.abstract: Foreign Policy Assn repts US-Latin-Amer relations at low ebb; sees USSR gaining

headline.main: AMERICAS ARE SEEN LEANING TO RUSSIA; Foreign Policy Group Reports Our Relations With Neighbors to South at a Low Ebb

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 -- Chile, India and Iran have signed the international air services transit agreement (the "two freedoms" document) since the close of the World Aviation Conference at Chicago, bringing the total to twenty-eight.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 -- Chile, India and Iran have signed the international air services transit agreement (the "two freedoms" document) since the close of the World Aviation Conference at Chicago, bringing the total to twenty-eight.
docs.abstract: final act signed by 53 nations (all except Liberia), interim agreement by 37, conv setting up permanent organization by 35, 2 freedoms by 28, 5 freedoms by 17

headline.main: TWO 'AIR FREEDOMS' NOW SIGNED BY 28; Twelve More Nations Have Agreed on the Five Aviation Conference Documents
